events.message: Customer filed a claim reporting a collision involving their car on April 29th at an intersection with another vehicle.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under the ‘Auto Accident’ cluster due to involvement of a vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was promptly assigned to handle the case and to guide the customer through the process.
The insurance company sent a formal acknowledgement email confirming receipt of the auto accident claim.
The agent requested the customer to submit the accident report, photos of the vehicle damage, and police documentation.
Customer uploaded all required documents including accident report, photographs of the damaged car, and police statement.
The claims investigation team began reviewing all submitted documents and contacted the other party involved in the accident.
Investigation concluded after verifying all reports and confirming liability was with the other driver involved in the collision.
An initial settlement amount was proposed to cover the repair costs and rental car expenses during the downtime.
The customer responded positively expressing satisfaction with the fair settlement and timely communication.
Approval was given for the settlement terms and repair work to proceed with the designated auto body shop.
Insurance payment disbursed promptly to cover repair bills and rental car reimbursement as per the settlement.
After confirmation of repairs and payment completion, the auto accident claim was officially closed with positive feedback.
All documents and communications related to the auto accident claim were archived for future reference and audit purposes.
